Sure, here is a more detailed implementation of the Vehicle Booking System using a more efficient database design:

Schema Design
-------------

The schema design consists of the following tables:

### Vehicles

This table stores information about the vehicles that are available for booking.

| Column Name | Data Type | Constraints |
| --- | --- | --- |
| vehicle\_id | INT | Primary Key, Auto Increment |
| vehicle\_type | VARCHAR(50) | Not Null |
| registration\_number | VARCHAR(50) | Unique, Not Null |
| model | VARCHAR(50) | Not Null |
| color | VARCHAR(50) | Not Null |
| capacity | INT | Not Null |
| driver\_id | INT | Foreign Key (Drivers), Not Null |

### Drivers

This table stores information about the drivers who are available for driving the vehicles.

| Column Name | Data Type | Constraints |
| --- | --- | --- |
| driver\_id | INT | Primary Key, Auto Increment |
| name | VARCHAR(100) | Not Null |
| email | VARCHAR(100) | Unique, Not Null |
| phone | VARCHAR(20) | Unique, Not Null |
| rating | DECIMAL(2,1) | Not Null |

### Customer\_Requests

This table stores information about the requests made by customers for booking a vehicle.

| Column Name | Data Type | Constraints |
| --- | --- | --- |
| request\_id | INT | Primary Key, Auto Increment |
| customer\_id | INT | Foreign Key (Customers), Not Null |
| pickup\_location | VARCHAR(100) | Not Null |
| destination | VARCHAR(100) | Not Null |
| travel\_date | DATE | Not Null |
| travel\_time | TIME | Not Null |
| status | ENUM('Pending', 'Accepted', 'Rejected', 'Cancelled') | Not Null |

### Bookings

This table stores information about the bookings made by customers.

| Column Name | Data Type | Constraints |
| --- | --- | --- |
| booking\_id | INT | Primary Key, Auto Increment |
| request\_id | INT | Foreign Key (Customer\_Requests), Not Null |
| vehicle\_id | INT | Foreign Key (Vehicles), Not Null |
| driver\_id | INT | Foreign Key (Drivers), Not Null |
| start\_time | DATETIME | Not Null |
| end\_time | DATETIME | Not Null |
| distance | DECIMAL(10,2) | Not Null |
| fare | DECIMAL(10,2) | Not Null |

### Customers

This table stores information about the customers who make the booking requests.

| Column Name | Data Type | Constraints |
| --- | --- | --- |
| customer\_id | INT | Primary Key, Auto Increment |
| name | VARCHAR(100) | Not Null |
| email | VARCHAR(100) | Unique, Not Null |
| phone | VARCHAR(20) | Unique, Not Null |

### Routes

This table stores information about the routes that are available for booking.

| Column Name | Data Type | Constraints |
| --- | --- | --- |
| route\_id | INT | Primary Key, Auto Increment |
| route\_name | VARCHAR(100) | Unique, Not Null |

Logical Flow of Data
--------------------

The logical flow of data in the system can be represented using the following diagram:
```rust
Customer Requests -> Bookings -> Drivers -> Vehicles -> Routes
```
Table Creation and Constraints
------------------------------

The tables can be created in MySQL using the following SQL commands:
```sql
CREATE TABLE Vehicles (
  vehicle_id INT NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,
  vehicle_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  registration_number VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL UNIQUE,
  model VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  color VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  capacity INT NOT NULL,
  driver_id INT NOT NULL,
```
